alert.note: Alert for Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:43PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Piscataquis, southeastern Aroostook and central Penobscot Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 743 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Katahdin, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Patten, Mount Katahdin, Sherman, Island Falls, southern Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument, Sherman Station, Baxter State Park, Stacyville, Crystal, Silver Ridge, Benedicta, Katahdin Lake, Monarda and Grindstone. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 255 and 275. State Highway 11 between Stacyville and Sherman Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Southeast Aroostook
